page.title: 01TRADE
page.content: NORTH OF THE RIVER THERE ARE NO LARGE SUPERMARKETS.IN THE CITY CENTRE AND SOUTH OF THE RIVER THERE ARE QUITE A NUMBER OF LARGE SHOPS WHICH PROVIDE A VARIED AMOUNT OF PRODUCE RANGING FROM ELECTRICAL APPLIANCES TO FOOD AND CLOTHING. PEOPLE OUTWITH THE CITY CENTRE RELY ON SMALL LOCAL SHOPKEEPERS FOR THEIR DAILY PROVISIONS.THEY ARE IMPORTANT TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY WHO RELY ON THEM FOR DAILY ITEMS SUCH AS NEWSPAPERS, MILK, CIGARETTES AND SWEETS.A POPULAR LOCAL NEWSPAPER IS{'THE DAILY RECORD'}WITH{'THE {BEANO'}THE MOST POPULAR CHILDRENS' COMIC.THE WORKING DAY IS A LONG ONE. ON AVERAGE THE SHOPS ARE OPEN FOR 13.5 HOURS A DAY.THE SHOPS ARE ALSO A MEETING PLACE WHERE THE NEWS AND VIEWS OF THE DAY CAN BE EXCHANGED.
